intro: Pouteria firma var. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits with a green, spiny rind and a sweet, creamy pulp. It is often cultivated for its edible fruit, which is rich in nutrients and has a unique flavor. Due to its ornamental value and fruit production, it is also appreciated in horticulture.
